overview_of_class: This course will explore the culture of literature and literary publishing in considering the place of serious writing in contemporary society. "Situation" in this context means both the condition of writing itself and how it is positioned in the greater social and cultural world; students will consider their roles as readers and writers. The course will have a particular focus on the role of publishing in shaping and reflecting literary culture and will consider topics in the history and current state of book and journal publishing. We'll discuss the establishment of literary publishers, the evolution of the paperback and other publishing models, the expansion and diffusion of publishing programs, the effects of the Internet, online publishing, and e-books on conventional structures, the roles of review publications and reviewers, the development of bookselling and the role of the chains, and related matters.
